fullDescription.intro:
Creates a new Spark Context. The settings e.g. dispose on reset affect all connected Spark nodes and their successors.
The default values of the node are taken from the Spark preference page which you can open via File->Preferences->KNIME->Spark.

tab.name: Context Settings
tab.option: The Spark version the Job Server is working with.
The unique name of the context.

If selected KNIME deletes the Spark context when the workflow or KNIME is closed. This way resources on the Spark job server are released but ALL nodes have to be re-executed the next time the workflow is opened.

If selected KNIME deletes the created Spark objects e.g. DataFrames/RDDs when the workflow or KNIME is closed. This way resources within the corresponding Spark context are released but ALL nodes have to be re-executed the next time the workflow is opened.
The log level to use for Spark jobs within the Spark runtime.
Select this option to enable user specific Spark context settings.
Custom settings to use in addition or to overwrite the default context settings defined in the Spark Job Server.
Enable this option to suppress context exists warning messages.

tab.name: Connection Settings
tab.option: The URL of the Spark job server including protocol and port e.g. http://localhost:8090.
Either none or user name and password which is required if authentication is enabled in the Spark job server.
Time to wait on a Spark job server REST request for a response (0 is infinite).
The frequency KNIME has to check the job status.
